<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Some LLVM programs such as bugpoint produce core files as a normal part of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// their operation. To prevent the disk from filling up, this function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// does what&#39;s necessary to prevent their generation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process/#a044be33f2a65605a957e19d5e8d549a5">Process::PreventCoreFiles</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifdef &#95;&#95;linux&#95;&#95;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On Linux, if the kernel.core&#95;pattern sysctl starts with a &#39;|&#39; (i.e. it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is being piped to a coredump handler such as systemd-coredumpd), the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// kernel ignores RLIMIT&#95;CORE (since we aren&#39;t creating a file in the file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// system) except for the magic value of 1, which disables coredumps when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// piping. 1 byte is too small for any kind of valid core dump, so it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// also disables coredumps if kernel.core&#95;pattern creates files directly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// While most piped coredump handlers do respect the crashing processes&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// RLIMIT&#95;CORE, this is notable not the case for Debian&#39;s systemd-coredump</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// due to a local patch that changes sysctl.d/50-coredump.conf to ignore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the specified limit and instead use RLIM&#95;INFINITY.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The alternative to using RLIMIT&#95;CORE=1 would be to use prctl() with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PR&#95;SET&#95;DUMPABLE flag, however that also prevents ptrace(), so makes it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// impossible to attach a debugger.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">  rlim.rlim&#95;cur = std::min&lt;rlim&#95;t&gt;(1, rlim.rlim&#95;max);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">  rlim.rlim&#95;cur = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  setrlimit(RLIMIT&#95;CORE, &amp;rlim);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(HAVE&#95;MACH&#95;MACH&#95;H) &amp;&amp; !defined(&#95;&#95;GNU&#95;&#95;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Disable crash reporting on Mac OS X 10.0-10.4</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">stat st;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    errno = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a137eaaa673e8fbf6bd1bfc41ea0c12b5">RetryAfterSignal</a>(-1, ::fstat, StandardFD, &amp;st) &lt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(errno &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;expected errno to be set if fstat failed!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// fstat should return EBADF if the file descriptor is closed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (errno != EBADF)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if fstat succeeds, move on to the next FD.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!errno)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(errno == EBADF &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;expected errno to have EBADF at this point!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NullFD &lt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Call ::open in a lambda to avoid overload resolution in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// RetryAfterSignal when open is overloaded, such as in Bionic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Open = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123; return ::open(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;/dev/null&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, O&#95;RDWR); &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((NullFD = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a137eaaa673e8fbf6bd1bfc41ea0c12b5">RetryAfterSignal</a>(-1, Open)) &lt; 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NullFD == StandardFD)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">      FDC.keepOpen();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (dup2(NullFD, StandardFD) &lt; 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::error&#95;code();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process/#a0777b5060c78b24c4765fffbac259f93">Process::SafelyCloseFileDescriptor</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FD) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Create a signal set filled with &#42;all&#42; signals.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Atomically swap our current signal mask with a full mask.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;THREADS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EC = pthread&#95;sigmask(SIG&#95;SETMASK, &amp;FullSet, &amp;SavedSet))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::error&#95;code(EC, std::generic&#95;category());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (sigprocmask(SIG&#95;SETMASK, &amp;FullSet, &amp;SavedSet) &lt; 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to close the file descriptor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We need to save the error, if one occurs, because our subsequent call to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pthread&#95;sigmask might tamper with errno.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ErrnoFromClose = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (::close(FD) &lt; 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ErrnoFromClose = errno;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Restore the signal mask back to what we saved earlier.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#a2e1cbb0e2bd7a35ed99c31853dc45374a3fd6b696867d70225deda7868308679b">EC</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;THREADS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#a2e1cbb0e2bd7a35ed99c31853dc45374a3fd6b696867d70225deda7868308679b">EC</a> = pthread&#95;sigmask(SIG&#95;SETMASK, &amp;SavedSet, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if !HAVE&#95;DECL&#95;ARC4RANDOM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GetRandomNumberSeed() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to get the initial seed from /dev/urandom, if possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> urandomFD = open(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;/dev/urandom&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, O&#95;RDONLY);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (urandomFD != -1) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> seed;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Don&#39;t use a buffered read to avoid reading more data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from /dev/urandom than we need.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/support/endian/#acfdf941f45bc58470ed8423b98862486">read</a>(urandomFD, (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;)&amp;seed, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(seed));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">    close(urandomFD);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return the seed if the read was successful.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a> == </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(seed))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> seed;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, swizzle the current time and the process ID to form a reasonable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// seed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Now = std::chrono::high&#95;resolution&#95;clock::now();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#add71474638430694c84640146383fc44">hash&#95;combine</a>(Now.time&#95;since&#95;epoch().count(), ::getpid());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process/#a92b058c34d04f6d0adf6eac3060343c6">llvm::sys::Process::GetRandomNumber</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if HAVE&#95;DECL&#95;ARC4RANDOM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> arc4random();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a> = (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(::srand(GetRandomNumberSeed())), 0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlight">  (void)x;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
